pr_title: Provision ES storage implementation based on configured ES version.

timeline.message: Renaming module, binding backends with version.
Pre-Binding export backend in a version-aware manner.
Using version specific providers to inject implementations based on config setting.
Renaming class, injecting providers in Map instead of instances.
Renaming module, binding backends with version.
Pre-Binding export backend in a version-aware manner.
Pre-Binding export backend in a version-aware manner.

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest renaming this to SUPPORTED_ES_VERSION. This would especially simplify understanding other classes where this constant is referenced.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it be enough to use bindForVersion(SUPPORTED_VERSION, ExportBackend.class); directly here instead of adding two additional private methods?
timeline.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: Sure, I did that before, I just consider this to be clearer regarding its intention.
replies.author: dennisoelkers

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I understand. Keeping the configure method tidy and easy to read is important.
I guess the only thing that really confused me was that that one of these two methods was in the base class ViewsModule. I would personally get rid of at least that one and move the call to bindForVersion into ViewsESBackendModule, but this is nothing that would keep me from merging this PR. :D
replies.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: registerQueryBackend(Version, String, ...) is supposed to be reused in future storage modules, that's why it is in ViewsModule.
replies.author: dennisoelkers

replies.bodyText: Alright, then let's leave it as it is.
replies.author: alex-konn
